author: Special Correspondent
text:
As a mission to spread smiles the city’s first cleft surgical mission will be formally launched on Monday.

The event will be held at New Medical Centre (NMC) with the aim to provide free comprehensive and life-altering reconstructive surgeries to children and adults with cleft lip, cleft palate or other facial deformities.

‘Mission Smile’, which will continue till February 19, is being jointly conducted by NMC and the Muthoot Pappachan Foundation.

Screening of patients is being held on Saturday and Sunday.

Highlights of the mission

'The highlights of the mission include surgeries to all patients, medicines and required investigations, food for patients and bystander and transportation---all being rendered free of cost, according to Dr. Arjun Sundaram, Chief Manager at NMC.

Mission Smile, formerly the Operation Smile India, was founded in 2002 and has so far performed over 25,000 cleft correction surgeries.

The mission features over 1,000 volunteers, 10 outreach centres across India and 76 medical missions, said Shivaji Samaddar, COO, Mission Smile.
title: First cleft surgical mission to be launched today
